description: From Latin lotus, past participle of lavare (“to wash”),  +‎ -ic.

adjectives.description: lotic (comparative more lotic, superlative most lotic)

entries.meaning: Characterised by flowing water; swiftly flowing; concerned with flowing rivers, streams, etc.
examples: This particular area is subject to the transition from a more lotic environment to the lentic environment existing in the pool area.

entries.meaning: (biology) Living in flowing water; adapted to life in flowing water.
examples: The stream-dwelling species are among the most lotic of anisopterous dragonflies.
